instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> White Screen, No Booting
threads.message: No signs or water damage, the back story we were told was that it went through a power surge and then wouldn't turn on again. Gets all power rails except <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is only 0.86 instead of the 1.25V noted in the schematic. After noticing this I found that the capacitors on the PPVCORE rail right above the PCH are all shorted to ground. I have removed <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR> and the short is stil present, should I just start popping of caps until the short goes away, or is it most likely a shorted CPU?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> White Screen, No Booting
threads.message:
0.86v is fine for CPU vcore. Also the capacitors above the PCH are not shorted to ground. Read this post and tell me why. [url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/22084-3332-<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>-7v?p=24887#post24887[/url]

Does this beep with no RAM installed?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> White Screen, No Booting
threads.message: OHH (face palm) that makes sense the low resistance gives the symptoms of a short. Wont make that mistake again! It does beep once repeatedly with no RAM installed.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> White Screen, No Booting
threads.message: Does it chime???, Image on external?? PRAM reset??

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> White Screen, No Booting
threads.message: It does PRAM reset, chimes, SMC resets, no image on external display either, when I use a USB bootable ASD drive the drive lights flash as it tries to initiate and then loops the same flash cycle over and over.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> White Screen, No Booting
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> White Screen, No Booting
threads.message:
No Title

Thanks Duke! I think I might have found something a little screwy, I will replace these components and check back in hopefully with an all fixed!
